segment.source: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell (Windows 10)
segment.target: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell (Windows 10)

segment.source: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Use VAMT in Windows PowerShell

segment.source: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) PowerShell cmdlets can be used to perform the same functions as the Vamt.exe command-line tool.
segment.target: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) PowerShell cmdlets can be used to perform the same functions as the Vamt.exe command-line tool.

segment.source: To install PowerShell 3.0
segment.target: To install PowerShell 3.0

segment.source: VAMT PowerShell cmdlets require Windows PowerShell, which is included in Windows 10, Windows 8 and Windows Server® 2012.
segment.target: VAMT PowerShell cmdlets require Windows PowerShell, which is included in Windows 10, Windows 8 and Windows Server® 2012.

segment.source: You can download PowerShell for Windows 7 or other operating systems from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: You can download PowerShell for Windows 7 or other operating systems from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: To install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit
segment.target: To install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit

segment.source: In addition to PowerShell, you must import the VAMT PowerShell module.
segment.target: In addition to PowerShell, you must import the VAMT PowerShell module.

segment.source: The module is included in the VAMT 3.0 folder after you install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).
segment.target: The module is included in the VAMT 3.0 folder after you install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).

segment.source: To prepare the VAMT PowerShell environment
segment.target: To prepare the VAMT PowerShell environment

segment.source: To open PowerShell with administrative credentials, click Start and type “PowerShell” to locate the program.
segment.target: To open PowerShell with administrative credentials, click Start and type “PowerShell” to locate the program.

segment.source: Right-click Windows PowerShell, and then click Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Windows PowerShell, and then click Run as administrator.

segment.source: To open PowerShell in Windows 7, click Start, click All Programs, click Accessories, click Windows PowerShell, right-click Windows PowerShell, and then click Run as administrator.
segment.target: To open PowerShell in Windows 7, click Start, click All Programs, click Accessories, click Windows PowerShell, right-click Windows PowerShell, and then click Run as administrator.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are using a computer that has an 64-bit processor, select Windows PowerShell (x86).
segment.target: If you are using a computer that has an 64-bit processor, select Windows PowerShell (x86).

segment.source: VAMT PowerShell cmdlets are supported for the x86 architecture only.
segment.target: VAMT PowerShell cmdlets are supported for the x86 architecture only.

segment.source: You must use an x86 version of Windows PowerShell to import the VAMT module, which are available in these directories:
segment.target: You must use an x86 version of Windows PowerShell to import the VAMT module, which are available in these directories:

segment.source: The x86 version of PowerShell is available in C:WindowsSysWOW64WindowsPowerShellv1.0powershell.exe
segment.target: The x86 version of PowerShell is available in C:WindowsSysWOW64WindowsPowerShellv1.0powershell.exe

segment.source: The x86 version of the PowerShell ISE is available in C:WindowsSysWOW64WindowsPowerShellv1.0powershellise.exe
segment.target: The x86 version of the PowerShell ISE is available in C:WindowsSysWOW64WindowsPowerShellv1.0powershellise.exe

segment.source: For all supported operating systems you can use the VAMT PowerShell module included with the Windows ADK.
segment.target: For all supported operating systems you can use the VAMT PowerShell module included with the Windows ADK.

segment.source: By default, the module is installed with the Windows ADK in the VAMT folder.
segment.target: By default, the module is installed with the Windows ADK in the VAMT folder.

segment.source: Change directories to the directory where VAMT is located.
segment.target: Change directories to the directory where VAMT is located.

segment.source: For example, if the Windows ADK is installed in the default location of , type:
segment.target: For example, if the Windows ADK is installed in the default location of , type:

segment.source: Import the VAMT PowerShell module.
segment.target: Import the VAMT PowerShell module.

segment.source: To import the module, type the following at a command prompt:
segment.target: To import the module, type the following at a command prompt:

segment.source: Where Import-Module imports a module only into the current session.
segment.target: Where Import-Module imports a module only into the current session.

segment.source: To import the module into all sessions, add an Import-Module command to a Windows PowerShell profile.
segment.target: To import the module into all sessions, add an Import-Module command to a Windows PowerShell profile.

segment.source: For more information about profiles, type .
segment.target: For more information about profiles, type .

segment.source: To Get Help for VAMT PowerShell cmdlets
segment.target: To Get Help for VAMT PowerShell cmdlets

segment.source: You can view all of the help sections for a VAMT PowerShell cmdlet, or you can view only the section that you are interested in.
segment.target: You can view all of the help sections for a VAMT PowerShell cmdlet, or you can view only the section that you are interested in.

segment.source: To view all of the Help content for a VAMT cmdlet, type:
segment.target: To view all of the Help content for a VAMT cmdlet, type:

segment.source: For example, type:
segment.target: For example, type:

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: The update-help cmdlet is not supported for VAMT PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: The update-help cmdlet is not supported for VAMT PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: To view online help for VAMT cmdlets, you can use the -online option with the get-help cmdlet.
segment.target: To view online help for VAMT cmdlets, you can use the -online option with the get-help cmdlet.

segment.source: For more information, see Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.
